154 CHESAPEAKE BAy BRIDGE

ESTIMATED COST OF BRIDGE AND APPROACHES

Sandy Point—Kent Island Site

The estimated cost of the bridge and approaches is summarized in
Table 66.

TABLE 66
Estimated Cost of Bridge and Approaches



A. Preliminary Expenses:

Surveys, Borings, Soil Analysis, Traffic Census.................coiviiiiiii .. $50,000
B. Cost of Rights-0f-Way . . ... ..o i e 5,000
C. Construction Cost:
SUBSETUCHUTE s v0i5s 1 fuss s s amsb s o bt ooty 5By v e ot el s 3 Aot $5,550,381
SUDETEETNCHIIES & - 0. 580 et e 85058 & i 0 R ) 5 ) A B 95 4858 7,086,782
Approach Roadways & Embankments. .................. ... ... ... ... 279,755
Toll Booths & Administration Building. ................................ 60,000
COntINEENCIES . .« .\ vttt et 223,082
Total Construction Cost. ...........oiiiiiiiiiitiiitiiiiriinenreereerrennnasnes 13,200,000
D. Engineering, Architectural, and Other Technical Service Fees....................... 830,000
E. Legal, Administrative and Overhead Expenses. . ..., 25,000



Total Estimated Cost of Bridge and Approaches Exclusive of Interest During
Construction and Bond Discount................. ..., $14,110,000



Alternate Design

Since the completion of the engineering work, upon which the estimated
cost herein presented is based, J. E. Greiner Company has investigated the
possible use of determinate continuous truss spans of a patented type,
instead of the Type “C’ cantilever truss spans estimated herein. The
arrangement of the spans, in case such continuous truss type is used, will be
somewhat different from the arrangement shown for this bridge in Volume
II, “Plates.” The question of the use of this alternate truss type will be
taken up with the Commission, and, if so authorized, J. E. Greiner Company
will submit a supplemental report to cover the results of the further in-
vestigations. Present indications are that the use of statically determinate
continuous truss units of this patented design will effect a considerable
saving. The question of royalties, which the Commission might have to
pay for a license to use the patented type of trusses, will be an element in
determining possible savings.

A. Preliminary Ezxpenses

The preliminary expenses, listed in Table 67, include expenses incurred
by the State Roads Commission for surveys, borings, traffic report and
